block.p: Barbara Judy Pless, a daughter of Aranka Anna Pless of Budapest and Fair Lawn, N.J., and the late Richard Pless, was married last evening to Peter Craig Turchin, a son of Cheryl and Martin Turchin of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla. Rabbi David J. Gelfand officiated at East Hampton Point, a restaurant in East Hampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Turchin, 30, is known as Judy. She is an associate in the commercial real estate group at Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, the New York law firm. She graduated with high honors from Rutgers University, where she also received a certificate in government studies. She received her law degree from Fordham University.

Rabbi David J. Gelfand officiated at East Hampton Point, a restaurant in East Hampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Turchin, 30, is known as Judy. She is an associate in the commercial real estate group at Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, the New York law firm. She graduated with high honors from Rutgers University, where she also received a certificate in government studies. She received her law degree from Fordham University.
The bride's father was a handbag designer in North Attleboro, Mass., for Whiting & Davis, a manufacturer of evening bags.
Mr. Turchin, 31, is a director at Insignia/ESG, a real estate company for which he is an agent representing landlords in commercial leasing agreements. His father is a vice chairman of the company.
The bridegroom graduated from Clark University and received a law degree from Hofstra. His previous marriage ended in divorce.
